page.title: 07EMPLOYMENT 2.
page.content: The current unemployment rate in the Digmoor area is about 40%, far in excess of the National average. The lack of job opportunities in the area has contributed significantly to the depressed state of the town. People have moved away leaving their houses to be vandalised and there is no incentive for newcomers to settle in the area. A whole generation is growing up, not knowing what it is like to have a father in employment. Any job opportunities which do arise seem to be in the smaller factory units There also seems to be more job openings in the area for women than for men. The Rural picture is quite the reverse with the ex-farm labourers and ex-miners cottages being bought and modernised by those in employment.
